intro: Odontites vernus subsp. fennicus, commonly known as the Fennoscandian toothworts, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern Europe and parts of Siberia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and wet meadows. Its small white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger leaves and more robust growth compared to the typical form of Odontites vernus.
